title: George Mira Jr.
text:
George Mira Jr. (born c. 1965) is a former an All-American Middle <a href="linebacker">linebacker</a> for the <a href="University%20of%20Miami">University of Miami</a> Hurricanes <a href="American%20football">football</a> team during the mid-1980s, taking over the reins after the departure of <a href="Jay%20Brophy">Jay Brophy</a>. He is also the son of former U.M <a href="quarterback">quarterback</a> <a href="George%20Mira">George Mira</a> Sr. He had a stellar career at the University of Miami until the 1987 National Championship Game, his last game of his senior year, before which he was suspended by the <a href="NCAA">NCAA</a> for <a href="diuretics">diuretics</a> use. The suspension endangered his <a href="Draft%20%28sports%29">draft</a> status, which sent him down to the 12th round of the <a href="1988%20NFL%20Draft">1988 NFL Draft</a>, where he was selected by the <a href="San%20Francisco%2049ers">San Francisco 49ers</a>, but did not manage an NFL game.
He is now a division chief for MDFR.
